Title: Triangle Pest Control
Best Fit: Letter of Intent

Title: Stahls Scholarship
Description: The Stahls Scholarship was created to help students in schools that support and develop entrepreneurship.    Applicants interested in applying should be attending an institution that supports entrepreneurship, skill development and/or graphic arts.    The completed application should also be submitted by a teacher, principal, or school employee with significant student involvement.
Best Fit: Applicants should have a desire to grow a clothing or heat-press business or start working in the custom clothing industry.  Applicant should also expect to provide a letter of permission signed by the school principal and/or superintendent including: the name of the school, indication of whether or not the school is public or private, and if public the Unified School District Number.

Title: Two Ten Footwear Foundation Scholarship
Summary: Two Ten works to help students who want to pursue a career in footwear design.
Description: Applicant must upload a current college transcript and maintain a 2.5 GPA or above.    Applicant should also be a U.S. citizen, eligible non-citizen, a Veteran or child of a veteran.    Applicant must also be enrolled or preparing to enroll in an accredited two or four year college, university, vocational/technical school or nursing school.
Best Fit: Must also compile a portfolio of relevant design work.  Design talent dependent.  Be pursuing a major or career in design.   Also must be attending recognized design program and must be interested in footwear design.

Title: Two Ten Footwear Design Scholarship
Description: Applicant must upload a current college transcript and maintain a 2.5 GPA or above.    Applicant should also be a U.S. citizen, eligible non-citizen, a Veteran or child of a veteran.    Applicant must also be enrolled or preparing to enroll in an accredited two or four year college, university, vocational/technical school or nursing school.
Best Fit: Applicant must have amassed at least 2 years or 1000 hours in the footwear design industry

Title: Alpha Sigma Lambda Scholarship
Summary: Honor’s students will be a great fit for the scholarships offered by Alpha Sigma Lambda.
Description: Grants will be made to adult students in continuing higher education based on scholarship, leadership, the clarity and content of their personal statement, strength of recommendation and need.
Best Fit: Adult students attending an institution with an Alpha Sigma Lambda chapter.   Completed at least 24 semester hours, not including CLEP or DANTES credit and not including any current coursework.   Enrolled in an associate’s or baccalaureate degree program.

Title: College Jumpstart Scholarship
Description: The College JumpStart Scholarship is an annual, merit-based competition in which financial need is not considered.  The main requirement is that you are committed to going to school and can express your goals for getting a higher education.
Best Fit: Applicants that best fit will be 10th-12th graders, college students and non-traditional students.

Title: Courage to Grow
Description: With the "Courage To Grow Scholarship," we strive to help students achieve their higher education goals. By taking away some of the concerns such as "how will I pay for college," students can concentrate on their education and focus on the task at hand.
Best Fit: Applicant must be a junior or senior in high school or college student with a minimum GPA of 2.5 or better. U.S. citizens only please.

Title: Dr Angela E Grant Memorial Scholarship
Description: The Dr. Angela E Grant Scholarship recognizes future scholars who have been affected by cancer and are dedicated to community service.
Best Fit: Scholarships are awarded to applicants based on essay quality, quality of applicatoin, extracurricular activities, achievemnts, community responsibility and leadership potential.  Applicants also should present either two recommendations or personal references.

Title: ewisp - Executive Women International Scholarship Program
Description: The Executive Women International Scholarship is a yearly, competition-based program that awards college scholarship money to high school seniors.
Best Fit: Must be located close to a participating EWI chapter.  Have contributed to their community as demonstrated by their involvement in extracurricular activities, employment, civic or volunteer activities.

Title: asist - Executive Women International Adult Students in Scholastic Transition
Description: The Adult Students in Scholastic Transition Scholarship Program helps give financial support to adult students at different stages in their educational journey.   EWI, the sponsoring company behind this scholarship, has been awarding scholarships for over 30 eyars and awards an average of over $80000 in scholarship each year.
Best Fit: Must be located close to a participating EWI chapter. Applicants should be past high school age and entering a college, university, or trade school and/or the workforce for the first time.  Applicants may also be non-traditional students already enrolled in a college, university, or trade school program or re-training due to changes in the workplace.

Title: Imagine America Adult Skills Education Program
Description: Imagine America Foundation’s Adult Skills Education Program is a set of grants intended to help students over 19 years of age return to school and gain additional skills for the workforce.   The Foundation requires that students create an account and submit an application for consideration.   They also offer many additional tools and resources for students wishing to figure out a prospective college path.
Best Fit: Must be enrolled in a participating college, have a high school diploma or GED or pass Ability to Benefit test.   Cannot have received any previous Imagine America Foundation scholarship.   Must have also completed the NCCT Educational Success Potential Assessment.

Title: Imagine America Military Award Program
Description: Imagine America Foundation’s Military Award Program is a set of grants intended to help ex-military students attend college or gain additional skills to enter the workforce.   The Foundation requires that students create an account and submit an application for consideration.   They also offer many additional tools and resources for students wishing to figure out a prospective college path.
Best Fit: Must be enrolled in a participating college, have a high school diploma or GED or pass Ability to Benefit test.   Cannot have received any previous Imagine America Foundation scholarship.   Must have also completed the NCCT Educational Success Potential Assessment.

Title: Niche.com No Essay Scholarship
Summary: Niche.com offers scholarships for nothing but signing up for an account on their website.
Description: The niche.com No Essay Scholarship is a $2000 scholarship for any high school or college student.    Applicant can either create a new account with Niche or login with an existing one to apply.
Best Fit: Must create an account on niche.com.  Must be at least 18 years of age or older or 13 years of age and older with a parent or guardian’s consent to create a new Niche.com account.

Title: Return2College.com Scholarship
Description: The Return2College.com scholarship is a $1000.00 award for studetns 17 or older wishing to begin a degree program within 12 months of the application submittal date.
Best Fit: Must apply on Return2College.com’s website as well as submit a very short (3 sentence) essay explaining why applicant wishes to return.   Can submit as much as 12 entries.

Title: Scholarship Detective Launch Scholarship
Description: Scholarship Detective is a free scholarship search engine offering two $1000.00 scholarships for students willing to submit an essay on how they plan to use their scholarship money.   Other than the essay, Scholarship Detective does not ask for any addiitonal criteria.
Best Fit: Application must write a 140 character or less statement describing how they will use the scholarship money.

Title: The $1,000 SuperCollege Scholarship
Description: The SuperCollege.com scholarship is a $1000 award for students of any age willing to apply.   Only requirements are that the application is filled out completely.
Best Fit: Applicant is expected to fill out a 12 question application.

Title: The $2,000 All Star College Scholarship
Description: The SuperCollege.com scholarship is a $2000 award for students of any age willing to apply.   Only requirements are that the application is filled out completely.
Best Fit: Applicant is expected to fill out a 12 question application.

Title: Unigo $10K Scholarship
Summary: Unigo is offering awards for talented students who can write an awesome and engaging essay.  The topic?  Would you want to be smart, funny or rich?
Description: The Unigo $10K scholarship is a $10000 award for any student with U.S. citizen wishing to attend college.   The Unigo team requires that applicants submit an essay explaining whether or not he or she would want to be smart, funny or rich.
Best Fit: Applicant will need to write a short essay describing if you would want to be smart, funny or rich and why.

Title: Cooke Undergraduate Transfer Scholarship
Description: The Jack Kent Cooke Foundation is offering a substantial scholarship for students of any age currently enrolled in a community college planning to attend a four year institution in fall of the following year.
Best Fit: Applicant must be attending a community college with the intention to enroll in a four year institution during the fall of the following year.   Applicant must not have already gotten college credit at a 4 year institution.   Applicant should have already completed at least 30 credit hours or more at the community college.  Applicant should also have a competitvely high GPA (at least above 3.25)

Title: Jeanette Rankin National Scholar Grant
Description: The Jeanette Rankin National Scholar Grant is offering substantial scholarships for women over 35 wishing to attend school with the intention of pursuing professional goals.
Best Fit: Application must be female or nonbinary, age 35 or older and demonstrate financial need.   Must also plan on pursuing education at a technical or vocational school, an associate’s degree or a first bachelor’s degree.

Title: Nucamp + Google Cloud Women in Tech Scholarshp
Description: Nucamp is offering grants for up to 25% of the cost of a Google Women in Tech Bootcamp.    The skills offered include certification in both front end and mobile web application development.  Please see the application site for more details.
Best Fit: Bootcamp?

Title: SME Education Foundation
Description: The SME Education Foundation is offering numerous scholarships for talented applicants looking to begin employment or pursue a degree in either manufacturing engineering or technology.
Best Fit: Must register an account with the SME Education Foundation.   Applicant should also have at least a 2.0 GPA.

Title: P.E.O. Program for Continuing Education (PCE)
Description: PEO International is sponsoring scholarships of varying amounts to talented female students enrolled in a certification or degree program at an accredited institution.
Best Fit: Applicant must have been out of school for at least 24 months in her adult life.  Applicant must be enrolled in a program that will either lead to employment or a job advance.   Applicant must be within 18 months of completing her educational program.   Applicant must not have already earned a master’s degree or above, and must not be enrolled in a post-master’s certificate or doctoral program.

Title: P.E.O. Scholar Award
Summary: Women looking to finish their post-doctorate or master’s studies should take a look at the offerings from PEO International.
Description: PEO International is sponsoring a scholarship of $20000.00 to talented female students enrolled in a Master’s or Post-Doctorate program at any accredited U.S. institution.
Best Fit: Applicant must posess at least a Bachelor’s degree.   Applicant must be within two years of her graudation date.

Title: Thermo Fisher Scientific Antibody Scholarship Program
Description: Thermo Fisher Scientific is offering scholarships in the range of $5000 to $10000 for students looking to pursue an education in the life sciences (e.g. Biology, Chemistry, Biological Engineering)
Best Fit: Will need to fill out an application form on website and an essay

Title: Colon Furr North American Legion Scholarship
Description: The Colon Furr Memorial Nursing Scholraship is open to any legal resident within North Carolina with the intention to attend a 1 year Licensed Practical Nurse program or who is already enrolled in a 2, 3 or 4 year program leading to certification as a registered nurse.
Best Fit: Applicant must be interested in pursuing an education or career in nursing.
Company: The Whitehurst-Ware Post No. 539 American Legion

Title: Air Traffic Control Full Time Employee Student Scholarship
Best Fit: Applicant or parent must be employed by aviation industry, must also be returning adult student.   Also must work full-time in aviation-related field and be enrolled in coursework designed to enhance air traffic control or aviation skills.   Must have min. 30 semester hours left until completion of degree or graduation.

Title: Buckingham Memorial Scholarship
Best Fit: Applicant or parent must be employed by aviation industry, and must also be either a child of a person serving or having served as an air traffic control specialist.

Title: Gabe A. Hartl Scholarship
Best Fit: Must have minimum or 30 semester hours left before degree completion and must be enrolled in air traffic control curriculum.

Title: The Kent W. Hamlin Memorial Scholarship
Best Fit: Applicant should have an interest in nuclear engineering and sciences.

Title: NEED Scholarship Award for Community College and Trade School
Description: The American Nuclear Society is sponsoring scholarships for students interested in Nuclear Engineering that have a greater than average need for financial aid.   Consideration is given to applicants with conditions or experiences that render them disadvantaged; including poor high school or undergraduate preparation, due to poverty
Best Fit: Applicant must demonstrate greater than average financial need.  Applicant should also have an interest in nuclear engineering and sciences.

Title: Operations and Power Division Scholarship
Best Fit: Applicant should have an interest in nuclear engineering and sciences.

Title: Angelo F. Bisesti Memorial Scholarship
Best Fit: Applicant should have an interest in nuclear engineering and sciences.

Title: Joseph R. Dietrict Memorial Scholarship
Best Fit: Applicant should have an interest in nuclear engineering and sciences.

Title: Raymond DiSalvo Memorial Scholarship
Best Fit: Applicant should have an interest in nuclear engineering and sciences.

Title: William R. and Mila Kimel Undergraduate Engineering Scholarship
Best Fit: Applicant should have an interest in nuclear engineering and sciences.

Title: Robert G. Lacy Memorial Scholarship
Best Fit: Applicant should have an interest in nuclear engineering and sciences.

Title: Robert T. (Bob) Liner Scholarship
Best Fit: Applicant should have an interest in nuclear engineering and sciences.

Title: Delayed Education Scholarship for Women
Best Fit: Must be a mature woman with an interest in a nuclear-related field but has had to put education on hold.

Title: James K. Vogt Radiochemistry Scholarship
Best Fit: Applicant should have an interest in nuclear engineering and sciences.

Title: UCB Epilepsy Scholarship
Description: The UCB, Inc. Epilepsy program offers educational scholarships to people living with epilepsy, family members, and caregivers to help them fulfill their dreams. UCB has awarded over $3 million in scholarships since 2005 to more than 580 recipients.  Applicants may mail or fax their materials to the number and address listed here.
Best Fit: Must be living with epilepsy and write an essay explaining how it affected your life.   Applicants are also encouraged to include their awards received and community involvement.

Title: L Phil & Alice J Walker School
Best Fit: Must be amateur radio operator holding a General Class license or higer.  Major may be in other fields related to those listed.

Title: L.B. Cebik, W4RNL & Jean Cebik, N4TZP Memorial Scholarship
Best Fit: Must be amateur radio operator holding Technician Class license or higher.  Major may be in other fields related to those listed.

Title: Thurgood Marshall College Fund
Description: Sallie Mae Fund and The Thurgood Marshall Fund have partnered to offer financial assistance to exemplary students attending an accredited college or university.   Applicants selected will be in good academic standing, but may be at risk of not returning due to outstanding financial need or an emergency situation that has otherwise impacted the applicant’s financial need.
Best Fit: Applicant must demonstrate financial need, high academic achievement. Applicant should be of good moral character and have a good record with their respective community.   Applicant should also have a GPA above 2.75, be able to demonstrate leadership capability, and answer a video statement explaining how education would benefit themselves, their family or community.

Title: Titan Web Agency Scholarship
Description: The Titan Web Agency is offering two $500 awards for applicants who are entrepreneurially minded and wish to attend a college or university.   Titan asks that applicants fill out a 1000 word essay explaining why they wish to become entrepreneurs along with a creative photo that represents them best.
Best Fit: Applicant must be attending an accredited two or four year institution.  Applicant must also submit a 1000 word essay.

Title: ASHRAE Region IV Benny Bottle Scholarship
Best Fit: Major or career interest in HVAC, architecture or engineering.  Student needs financial need, high academic acheivement, depth of character, leadership.

Title: ASHRAE President’s Scholarship
Description: The ASHRAE Presiden’ts scholarship is an award offering students up to two years of aid.   Applicant must be at least a junior in college or have finished at least 45 credit hours at a particular institution.
Best Fit: Applicant should be a current ASHRAE student member, attend an instituion that hosts a recognized ASHRAE student branch.  Applicant should also be a full time student enrolled in a Bachelor of Science engineering curriculum with a focus on HVAC or refrigeration.

Title: ASHRAE David C. J. Peters Scholarship
Description: The David C. J. Peters Scholarship is a one-year annual scholarship available to applicants interested in purisng a career in mechnical or architectural engineering.   The applicant must be a full-time student of any of the following universities: North Carolina A&T State University, North Carolina State University, Clemson University, Virginia Tech.
Best Fit: Applicant should be a current ASHRAE student member, attend an instituion that hosts a recognized ASHRAE student branch.  Applicant should also be a full time student enrolled in a Bachelor of Science engineering curriculum with a focus on HVAC or refrigeration.

Title: ASHRAE James R. Bullock Scholarship
Description: The James R. Bullock Scholarship is a one-year scholarship available to applicants interested in purisng a career in mechnical or architectural engineering.   Applicant should have also graduated from a high school within North Carolina, South Carolina or Georgia.
Best Fit: Applicant should be a current ASHRAE student member, attend an instituion that hosts a recognized ASHRAE student branch.  Applicant should also be a full time student enrolled in a Bachelor of Science engineering curriculum with a focus on HVAC or refrigeration.
